text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This transmits revised IRM 4.17.4, Compliance Initiatives Projects, Procedures.
This section has been updated with the following signiﬁcant changes:
a. IRM
–Removed information already included in other sections. b. IRM
–Clariﬁed when a Part Two is appropriate. c. IRM
–Deﬁned the naming convention and provided examples. d. IRM
–Clariﬁed what should be included in Background and Objectives. e. IRM
–Clariﬁed what should be included in Market Segment including thresholds. f. IRM
–Relocated requirement for a speciﬁc completion date from another section. g. IRM
–Consolidated all Part One approval requirements to a single section. Updated approval requirements and created consistency among functions. h. IRM
–Updated LB&I speciﬁc Part One approval requirements. i. IRM
–Clariﬁed a Part Two does not need to be preceded by a Part One. j. IRM
–Consolidated all Part Two approval requirements to a single section. Updated approval requirements and created consistency among functions. k. IRM
–Consolidated all extension requirements to a single section. l. IRM
–Consolidated all termination requirements to a single section. Added procedure to apply Aging Reason Code
at project expiration. Updated LB&I Procedures. Changed date to
days following project completion date. m. IRM
–Added LB&I Workload Selection Form.
Compliance employees within all Operating Divisions.
Table of Contents
) The following procedures provide direction for the preparation, review, approval, and reporting of CIPs, as well as guidelines for extensions, tions, and terminations. (

) Language in the CIP authorization request must be speciﬁc. Blanket and broad, undeﬁned coverage are not acceptable. The authorization speciﬁcally identify the market segment and the potential area(s) of ance. (
) There are four types of CIP requests. (
) Part
CIP - A Part
CIP authorization is requested when fewer than
CIP Request taxpayer contacts are anticipated for a ﬁeld office compliance initiative.
Compliance Initiative Project Authorization - Part One, is used to request a Part One CIP Authorization. (
) Part
CIP- A Part
CIP authorization is requested to expand a Part
, the Part
reveals documented non-compliance, or when there is an established compliance risk. Form
Compliance Initiative Project zation - Part Two, is used to request a Part Two CIP Authorization. (
) National Office CIP - A National Office CIP authorization is one requested a headquarters function. Form
or Form
is used based on the scriptions in paragraph
and
above. See IRM
, National CIP. (
) Cross-functional CIP A Cross-functional CIP authorization is one jointly requested by two or more business operating divisions. Form
or
is used based on the descriptions in paragraph
and
above. See IRM
, Cross Operating Division CIP Approval Process. (

) For purposes of recording and accessing CIPs in a national database, a naming convention should be used for titling projects. The convention is [Function - Project Code - primary issue(s) or market segment (if available) CIP Type - Completion Date]: Example: HQ PC
Unreported Income by Referees Part I
Example: HQ PC 9999 Unreported Income by Referees Part I 01312017
Example: ET TC 8888 Employment Tax Issue Part II 006302017
The market segment should not be taxpayer speciﬁc.
) Form
, Compliance Initiative Project Authorization - Part One, requests approval for a CIP. It is hereinafter referenced as Part One CIP in this IRM. (
) In the following circumstances the authorization request may be limited to Part One CIP only: • To acquire and evaluate external data not publicly available. • To contact
or fewer taxpayers (
or fewer in Collection or Campus).
Form 13502, Compliance Initiative Project Authorization - Part One, requests approval for a CIP. It is hereinafter referenced as Part One CIP in this IRM.

4.17 Compliance Initiative Projects

Provide information to explain the basis for selecting the proposed project. If the authorization request is for Part One CIP only, identify the circumstance from IRM 4.17.4.3, Part One CIP Authorization Request that permits the use of Part One CIP. Explain the issue(s) and additional information such as;

Similar or prior projects need to be considered even if they are from different exam areas or divisions. Authorization must clear justiﬁcation for repeating a project. The authorization request must also contain the results to date of the previous project, including the no change rate and other applicable metrics.
A market segment is generally a group containing similar characteristics. Examples of market segments include but are not limited to the following:
The market segment section should also include:
The CIP Authorization should have a speciﬁc project completion date.

In addition to IRM 4.17.4.3.5, Review, Concurrence and Approval Part One CIP Only and IRM 4.17.4.4.4, Review, Concurrence and Approval Part Two Authori- zation Requests LB&I authorization review is conducted in the following order:

Industry forwards CIP and Workload Selection Form to the LB&I CIP Analyst. LB&I CIP Analyst forwards the CIP to the Compliance Planning & Analytics (CP&A) Research Manager. The methodology proposed for identifying/selecting returns must be approved by the CP&A Research Manager.
LB&I CIP Analyst forwards the CIP to the Risk Identiﬁcation Control Board for review and concurrence.
CIP is presented by the CIP owner to the LB&I CIP Oversight Committee.
CIP is presented to Directors of Field Operations (DFO’s) during conference calls.

CIP is presented to the Executive Governance Board (EGB). Minutes from both the DFO calls and EGB calls should be forwarded to the CIP Analyst by the originating Industry. Note: If an authorization request originates in Compliance Planning Analytics (CP&A), and is a regular workload selection CIP, approval from the EGB would not be required.
Final review is conducted by the CP&A, Operations Planning & Senior Manager, and ﬁnal approval is from the CP&A, Director.

, Compliance Initiative Project Authorization - Part Two, is used (
) request approval for a Part Two CIP Authorization. It is hereinafter Part Two CIP as Part Two CIP in this IRM. Authorization Request (

) A Part Two CIP Authorization request contains all the information required Part One. A Part Two is requested when there is a documented, level of non-compliance. It is not necessary for a Part Two to be preceded Part One.
) Documented consideration should be given to identify alternative non- (
) enforcement ways to improve voluntary compliance as enforcement is Alternative Treatments generally very labor intensive. Examples are: • Taxpayer outreach/education. See IRM

, Communications Stakeholder Outreach (CSO) Managers/Directors • Revisions to forms or publications • Legislative or regulatory changes • Agreements with state or local business licensing authorities for tax compliance requirements

Compliance Initiative (

) Minor modiﬁcations may be made to CIPs. The modiﬁcations should be mented by notation or addendum to the original authorization request. The to CIPs approver of the original authorization should be notiﬁed. Examples of minor modiﬁcations include: • Expansion to other return types • Name changes • Expansion to other Posts of Duty • Expansion to subsequent tax years Minor modiﬁcations must not change the intent of the original CIP. (
) Major modiﬁcations, those that change the intent of the original CIP, require the submission of a new authorization request (refer to IRM
, Concurrence and Approval Part One CIP Only for Part One CIP and IRM
, Review, Concurrence and Approval Part Two Authorization Requests for Part Two CIP and IRM

, Overview for TE/GE speciﬁc IRMs). Examples include: • Changing the market segment • Introducing a new use for external data • Change or expansion of issues; except those related to the original issue(s) (

) If it is necessary to extend a project beyond the project completion date, approval is required. The extension must be approved at the level of the of Project approving the original CIP. A CIP is approved for extension in the “extension time” section on the original authorization document (Form
, Part or Form
, Part Two CIP). Note: The extension must be approved prior to the current project completion date. It is recommended that CIP extension request be submitted for approval
business days before the project completion date (
) No extension is needed to complete project returns already in process at project completion date. For the purpose of IRM
returns already in process include returns where the taxpayer has been contacted, or primary returns authorized by the project already updated to AIMS status
or IRM
,, Project Termination and Report. (
) Operating Unit Speciﬁcs Division Special Procedures • The Director ECS must approve all extensions exceeding
months beyond the original project completion date. • A copy of the Extension must be forwarded to the SB/SE CIP Program Analyst.
4.17 Compliance Initiative
Changing the market segment Introducing a new use for external data Change or expansion of issues; except those related to the original issue(s)
Special Procedures

Procedures 4.17.4 page 9 Division Special Procedures LB&I • All Part One & Part Two CIP extensions must be presented to the LB&I CIP Oversight Committee. For purposes of this section, only concurrence from the DFO monthly conference call is required. This must be documented in the minutes of the meeting. • Final approval is obtained from the Operations Planning & Support Senior Manager and the LB&I CP&A Director. The LB&I CIP Analyst will coordinate ﬁnal extension approval. Note: These procedures apply to Part One & Part Two CIP’s approved prior to August 2011. • A copy of the CIP extension must be forwarded to the SB/SE HQ CIP Program Analyst. TE/GE A copy of the extension must be forwarded to the designated Compliance Program Manager for EO, EP or GE/SS having responsibility for the CIP database.
Special Procedures
copy of the extension must be forwarded to the designated Manager for EO, EP or GE/SS having responsibility for the CIP

) CIPs should be terminated prior to the authorized project completion date completing the termination report when any of the following conditions been met: • Noncompliance has been addressed. • Resources are no longer available. • Other circumstances indicate that the project is no longer viable. (
) A termination report, Form
, Compliance Initiative Project Termination Report, must be submitted within
days after the project tion date including extensions, per the authorization. (
) The termination report will be prepared by the CIP coordinator and signed the approver of the CIP outlined in IRM
Review, Concurrence Approval of Part One CIP Only or IRM
Review, Concurrence Approval Part Two Authorization Requests. (
) If a Part One CIP is expanded to a Part Two CIP, (due to the results the Part One CIP Authorization request) then the Part One CIP is automatically terminated and no report is needed. (
) CIP inventory AIMS status
or above at the project completion date, or a termination report has been approved (whichever is earlier), should be updated with Aging Reason Code

(CIP Cases Closed After Issuance of mination Report). The procedure applies to returns in the exam group, suspense or Technical Services suspense. This will allow for the distinction between the inventory (before and after the project completion report- whichever is earlier).

CIP Status AIMS Status Code Action At Project Completion Date Cases Not Built and not estab- No new cases should be built Including Extensions or Termi- lished on AIMS with project data nation Report Completed Cases Status 08 or Below Dispose of Cases and data (Whichever is earlier) Cases Status 10 or Above Update to Aging Reason Code 29 and continue exam (6) Operating Unit Speciﬁcs Division Special Procedures SB/SE A copy of the termination report must be forwarded to the SB/SE HQ CIP Program Analyst LB&I • CIP results are reviewed by CP&A, Workload Identiﬁcation/ Selection. The review will consist of an analysis of project ﬁndings and results. • Findings will be presented to the Director, CP&A for potential dis- cussion and consideration during the monthly DFO conference calls. Consideration will be given to whether CIP ﬁndings will be used in future workload selection. • All Part One and Two CIP Terminations must be presented to the CIP Oversight Committee: Step 1, DFO conference calls Step 2, EGB conference calls Note: Concurrence is received only in this order. Review will be documented in the minutes of the meetings . • The Industry owner of the CIP forwards committee meeting minutes to the LB&I CIP Analyst who will coordinate ﬁnal approval. • Final termination approval is obtained from the Operations Planning & Support Senior Manager and the LB&I Compliance Planning & Analytics (CP&A) Director. • A copy of the CIP Termination must be forwarded to the SB/SE HQ Program Analyst. Note: All Part 1 and Part 2 Terminations for CIP’s in existence prior to August 2011 require approval through only Step One, the DFO Conference call level. All other procedures through Step One described above are applicable. If the CIP for any reason required presentation to the EGB in the past, approval through Step 2 would also be required for the termination. TE/GE • TE/GE functional areas follow their respective IRMs for termination reports, completion dates and tracking codes. See IRM 4.17.1.1, Overview • The TE/GE termination report will be prepared by the CIP team and signed by the persons who approved the CIP Authorization.

Program Analyst • CIP results are reviewed by CP&A, Workload Identiﬁcation/ Selection. ) If the CIP issue and market segment are national in scope, a national CIP should be considered. It can originate in the Area or in the Headquarters, Campus, Specialty functional units, or TE/GE divisions. (
) A national CIP follows the same approval requirements outlined in IRM
, Review, Concurrence and Approval of Part One CIP Only or
, Review, Concurrence and Approval Part Two Authorization Requests. (
) Headquarters will retain the original authorization request after approval. Copies will be made available to the appropriate Program Managers. (
